org.jetel.util.property

Class PropertyRefResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.property.PropertyRefResolver

  • public class PropertyRefResolver
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for evaluation of CTL expressions and resolving of property references within string values. The CTL expressions present in a string value are evaluated first. Property references present in these CTL expressions are resolved before evaluation. Then the property references are resolved. CTL expressions present in the referenced properties are evaluated after resolving. This mechanism enables arbitrary nesting of CTL expressions and property references within the properties.

    By default, CTL expressions have to be enclosed within back quotes, i.e. `<ctl_expression>`, and property references use the ${} notation, i.e. ${property_reference}. Escaped back quote, i.e. \`, within CTL expressions produces a single back quote in the result. This behaviour might be altered by modifying the Defaults.GraphProperties.EXPRESSION_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX and Defaults.GraphProperties.PROPERTY_PLACEHOLDER_REGEX configuration properties. Expression evaluation might be disabled by setting the Defaults.GraphProperties.EXPRESSION_EVALUATION_ENABLED configuration property to false. NOTE: this class is not thread safe

    Since:
    12th May 2004

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropertyRefResolver

        public PropertyRefResolver()
        Constructs a PropertyRefResolver with empty properties. By default, the CTL expressions will be evaluated and the property references will be resolved. This may be changed by setting the resolve flag to false.

      • PropertyRefResolver

        public PropertyRefResolver(java.util.Properties properties)
        Constructs a PropertyRefResolver for the given properties. By default, the CTL expressions will be evaluated and the property references will be resolved. This may be changed by setting the resolve flag to false.
        Parameters:
        properties - properties to be used for resolving references

      • PropertyRefResolver

        public PropertyRefResolver(GraphParameters graphParameters)

      • PropertyRefResolver

        @Deprecated
public PropertyRefResolver(TransformationGraph graph)
        Deprecated. call new PropertyRefResolver(graph.getGraphProperties()) instead
        Constructs a PropertyRefResolver for properties of the given graph. By default, the CTL expressions will be evaluated and the property references will be resolved. This may be changed by setting the resolve flag to false.
        Parameters:
        graph - a graph with properties to be used for resolving references

        Sets the flag specifying whether the CTL expressions should be evaluated and the property references resolved.
        Parameters:

      • isResolve

        public boolean isResolve()
        Returns:
        true if the CTL expressions will be evaluated and the property references will be resolved, false otherwise

      • resolveRef

        public java.lang.String resolveRef(java.lang.String value)
        If resolving is enabled, evaluates CTL expressions and resolves property references in the given string. After that, special characters are resolved. Does nothing if resolving is disabled.
        Parameters:
        value - a string containing CTL expressions and property references
        Returns:
        the value with CTL expressions evaluated and property references resolved or the same value if resolving is disabled

      • resolveRef

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String resolveRef(java.lang.String value,
                                     boolean resolveSpecChars)
        Deprecated. to turn off the special characters resolving call resolveRef(value, RefResOption.ALL_OFF) instead
        If resolving is enabled, evaluates CTL expressions and resolves property references in the given string. After that, special characters are resolved only if requested. Does nothing if resolving is disabled.
        Parameters:
        value - a string containing CTL expressions and property references
        resolveSpecChars - flag specifying whether special characters within string values should be resolved and CTL expressions within the global scope should be evaluated
        Returns:
        the value with CTL expressions evaluated and property references resolved or the same value if resolving is disabled

      • resolveRef

        public java.lang.String resolveRef(java.lang.String value,
                          RefResFlag flag)
        If resolving is enabled, CTL expressions and special characters resolving is dedicated by options parameter. Does nothing if resolving is disabled.
        Parameters:
        value - a string containing CTL expressions and property references
        flag - flag specifying whether special characters within string values should be resolved and CTL expressions within the global scope should be evaluated
        Returns:
        the value with CTL expressions evaluated and property references resolved or the same value if resolving is disabled

      • anyErrorOccured

        public boolean anyErrorOccured()
        Returns:
        true if any error occurred during the last call to the resolveRef(StringBuilder, RefResFlag) method, false otherwise

      • getErrorMessages

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getErrorMessages()
        Returns:
        a read-only list of error messages collected during the last call to the resolveRef(StringBuilder, RefResFlag) method

      • resolveAll

        public void resolveAll(java.util.Properties properties)
        Evaluates CTL expressions and resolves property references present in each property in the given properties. The result is then stored back into the given properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - properties to be resolved

      • resolveAll

        public void resolveAll(java.util.Properties properties,
              RefResFlag refResFlag,
              java.lang.String... excludedProperties)
        Evaluates CTL expressions and resolves property references present in each property in the given properties. The result is then stored back into the given properties.
        Parameters:
        properties -
        refResFlag -

        refResFlag - flag which is used by resolver
        Returns:

      • containsProperty

        public static boolean containsProperty(java.lang.String value)
        Indicates if given string contains also property reference (that needs to be de-referenced)
        Parameters:
        value - value to inspect
        Returns:
        true if value contains reference to at least one property.

      • isPropertyReference

        public static boolean isPropertyReference(java.lang.String value)
        Parameters:
        value - tested string
        Returns:
        true if the given string is represents reference to property, for example "${abc}"; false otherwise
